page.title: 05Miners Strike in Ferrybridge
page.content:
When my dad was on strike if I needed clothes badly my mum said "Sorry but we can't afford it".I hated it in winter,we only had 2 or 3 bags of coal to last for 2 weeks.We only lit a fire in the room at night.I had to have 3 or 4 extra covers on in bed.Dad made dolls houses to sell for Christmas presents.Every day when I came home from school I was tired hearing about the strike.My mum & dad talked about nothing else 24 hours a day.
The strike didn't really effect us in our house.I still got pocket money.But there was a feeling just to have lived in Ferrybridge,to have witnessed all the awful things.We knew Joe Green,he promised me a Scottish pound note.He was killed by a lorry doing his job as a picket at the power station.
